NULL values affect the results of aggregate functions (like SUM, AVG).

o: A virtual table based on a query

q: You can update data in a view (with some restrictions).

COUNT(*) counts rows containing NULL values.

The NOT operator displays a record if the condition(s) is NOT TRUE.

Indexes speed up SELECT queries but slow down UPDATE/INSERT statements.

What does SQL stand for?

A NULL value is treated as FALSE in a boolean expression.

c: SELECT CASE WHEN 1=1 THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END;

q: Rearrange CASE Statement:

You cannot perform arithmetic operations within a SELECT statement.

TRUNCATE is generally faster than DELETE without a WHERE clause.

You can use multiple tables in the FROM clause.

CHAR data type has a fixed length.

What is the logical order of operations in SQL?
o: FROM -> WHERE -> GROUP BY -> HAVING -> SELECT -> ORDER BY
SELECT -> FROM -> WHERE -> GROUP BY -> HAVING -> ORDER BY
FROM -> SELECT -> WHERE -> GROUP BY -> HAVING -> ORDER BY
SELECT -> WHERE -> FROM -> GROUP BY -> HAVING -> ORDER BY

q: Rearrange SQL Order of Execution:

LOWER() and LCASE() often do the same thing depending on the SQL dialect.

REVOKE removes user permissions.

The HAVING clause cannot contain aggregate functions.
The _____ operator checks for values within a range.

The _____ command executes a stored procedure.

Row-Level Security (RLS) restricts access to rows based on a user's execution context.
The _____ feature limits sensitive data exposure by masking it to non-privileged users.
Match Security Feature:
Which technology keeps a standby database in sync by restoring transaction logs?
Rearrange RLS creation:

Database Mirroring is deprecated in newer versions of SQL Server.
The _____ feature allows you to govern resource consumption by different workloads.
Match High Availability:

CXPACKET wait type typically indicates parallelism issues.

Query Store is enabled by default in Azure SQL Database.

Snapshot replication copies the entire snapshot of data each time.

DBCC SHRINKDATABASE is recommended to run regularly.

Extended Events (XEvents) are lighter weight than SQL Profiler.

Fragmentation can be reduced by rebuilding or reorganizing indexes.

Backup compression increases CPU usage but decreases I/O.

A tail-log backup captures the log records that have not yet been backed up (the tail of the log).

Match Backup Type:
Which system database stores all system-level information for an SQL Server instance?
Rearrange Backup Syntax:
Which system database is used by SQL Server Agent for scheduling alerts and jobs?
The tempdb database is recreated every time SQL Server starts.

NOLOCK hints can cause dirty reads and potentially skip rows or read them twice.
A _____ occurs when two processes are waiting for each other to release resources.

A Covering Index includes all the columns referenced in a query.

xp_cmdshell is enabled by default for security reasons.

Database Snapshots use sparse files to store data pages as they act on Copy-on-Write.

Full Scan statistics update provides the most accurate histogram.

Using a GUID as a clustered index key is generally best for performance.

Database Mail uses SMTP to send emails.

Latches are lightweight synchronization primitives used to protect shared memory structures.
